name: Pandemics in Perspective: History of Contagion Before and After Covid
description:
How has living through a pandemic reshaped our understanding of the history of contagion and the broader discipline of the history of medicine? Join Flurin Condrau as he examines the profound impact of the recent Covid-19 pandemic. Condrau will explore how the experience of living through a pandemic shifts historical perspectives on infection.

The pandemic has not only created new avenues for public engagement but also inspired profound reconsideration of the purpose and scope of medical history.
Come be a part of this thought-provoking lecture and gain fresh insights into the ways global health crises reshape our understanding of disease, society, and the role of history in public health.

name: Power Shifts in Bengaluru: Sci560 Exhibition walkthrough
description: Mediators Aditi and Pravallika take you on an exhibition walkthrough exploring how power struggles have shaped science, technology, and culture in Bengaluru. The walkthrough focuses on the colonial era, post-independence progress, and contemporary issues. Through key objects and stories, the walkthrough highlights themes of gender inequality in science, the digital divide & the labor question. Join us as we explore the stories about power struggle, oppression and empowerment in Bengaluru.

name: Anthropo-Scenes: A Sci560 Exhibition Walkthrough
description:
For the past few decades, human activity has left an indelible mark on the Earth, leading to the proposed geological epoch called the Anthropocene. Though there is still debate on when the Anthropocene has started, in the midst of the climate crisis, there is an urgent call to acknowledge our lasting influence on the planet.
Join mediators Fathima Aslaha and Gaayatri Chandrasekharan as they explore the Anthropocene through the lens of Bengaluru—a city where nature perseveres amidst the pressures of rapid urbanisation. Using the Sci560 exhibition season as an anchor, they ask what a sustainable future in the city looks like.
